thread.title: Mumbai: 2 held by EOW with 1,561 pirated books worth Rs 4.75 lakh
thread.title_full: Mumbai: 2 held by EOW with 1,561 pirated books worth Rs 4.75 lakh | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: dna
title: Mumbai: 2 held by EOW with 1,561 pirated books worth Rs 4.75 lakh
text:
Economic Offences Wing (EOW) sleuths on Saturday arrested two persons for allegedly selling pirated books of renowned national and international authors.
The police have seized as many as 1,561 pirated books amounting to Rs4.75 lakh and are now probing whether more people are involved in the racket. The arrested due has been identified as Manzoor Ibrahim Khan and Deepak Saha.
According to the police, complainants Nirajkumar Dahiya and Rajesh Mishra are residents of Noida in Uttar Pradesh and are official representatives of Publishers Association of UK & USA. Their company has copyright of books of some national and international authors and books are sold across the country through their company.
"Dahiya and Mishra had received information that a few persons are involved in piracy of books there by violating copyright norms. They told the police that a huge consignment of books has been kept in Bandra. After verifying their information a shop was raided at Bandra's Gareeb Nagar and the books were seized," said an EOW officer.
"Khan and Saha have been booked on charges of cheating under relevant sections of Indian Penal Code and Copyright Act. We are probing from where they got the material and if more people are involved," the officer said.
